DOC.brief_summary: The goal of this research study is to learn about ways to check for malnutrition (loss of weight/appetite that may result in health problems) that is due to cancer or cancer treatment.
DOC.detailed_description: If participant agrees to take part in this study, information from their medical record will be collected at each of their standard of care clinic visits. This information may include things like participant's height, weight, BMI, medical history, and performance status (their ability to perform normal daily activities). If the doctor thinks it is needed, participant's weight and performance status will be measured at standard of care clinic visits. The distress plan for managing patients who endorse depressive symptoms as indicated by PHQ-9 is to treat them with anti-depressants, social support will be also provided Every 3 months for up to 1 year, participant will be contacted by a member of the study staff, either by phone or during a regularly-scheduled standard of care visit at MD Anderson. Participant will be asked about their health and weight, about any falls or injuries they may have had, and about any hospitalization or ER visits they may have had. If participant is called, the phone call should last about 15 minutes. Length of Study: Participation on the study will be over after the 12-month follow-up visit or phone call. This is an investigational study. Up to 284 participants will be enrolled in this study. All will take part at MD Anderson.
DOC.criteria: 1. Over 65 years of age older 2. With hematologic and solid tumor cancers 3. Undergo a comprehensive geriatric assessment by a geriatrician 1. Unable or unwilling to sign consent form 2. Life expectancy under 6 months.
